description: Construction of a two storey detached house (with accommodation in the roofspace); one off-street parking spcae; associated amenity space, refuse enclosure and shed (incorporatiing cycle storage) (Replacing previously demolished dwellinghouse)
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.  REASON:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title numbers 11565/2/ 01, 02 Rev. B,  11, 13  and 14 received 16/05/2013, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local Planning Authority. REASON: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | Samples of the materials to be used for the external surfaces (including windows), of the dwellinghouse hereby approved  shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development is commenced, and this condition shall apply notwithstanding any indications as to these matters which have been given in this application.  Development shall be carried out in accordance with these approved details. REASON:	In the interest of securing a high quality development and to ensure that the resulting appearance and construction of the development preserves the character of the building and  the visual amenity of the area as a whole in accordance with section 7 the National Planning Policy Framework, policies 3.5, 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan 2011 and policies 4.1 and 5.5 of the adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and policy 3.8  of the Ealing's (Core) Development Strategy and and 7B of the Draft Ealing Development Management Plan Document (published February 2013). | The dwellinghouse hereby approved shall be constructed to meet Lifetime Homes Standards. REASON: To ensure access for all for future occupiers in accordance with policy 7.2 of the London Plan 2011 and policy 5.3 of the adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | The dwellinghouse hereby approved shall comply with the standards of 'Secured by Design'.   REASON:  To ensure the safety of future residents, and to ensure that the proposed development achieves the required crime prevention elements in accordance with policy 7.3 of the London Plan 2011, policies 4.1, 4.4 and 5.5 of the of the adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and the Council's Supplementary Guidance 08 ' Safer Ealing'. | No occupation of the dwellinghouse hereby approved shall take place until full details of hard/soft landscape works and all boundary/enclosure treatments, including a phased programme of works, have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority and these works shall be completed as approved prior to the first occupation of any part of the development or in accordance with the programme agreed by the Local Planning Authority.  Any trees or other plants which die or are removed within the first five years following the implementation of the landscaping scheme shall be replaced during the next planting season.  REASON:  To ensure that the development is satisfactorily landscaped in the interests of the visual character and appearance of the area and setting of the building, and in accordance with policies 3.5, 7.4 and 7.21 of the London Plan 2011 and policies 4.1, 4.5 and 5.5 of the adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and policy 3.8 of the Ealing's Development Strategy. | The cycle/refuse storage shown on the approved plans 11565/2/ 11 and 13 shall be made available for use prior to first occupation of the dwelling, and this storage shall not be used for any other purpose. 	 REASON:  To ensure that there is adequate provision for refuse storage within the site, in accordance with policies 6.9 of the London Plan 2011, 2.10 and  4.1 of the Adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 04 'Refuse and Recycling Facilities'. | Details shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for approval before the development is commenced, for the insulation of the building envelope, with windows shut and other means of ventilation provided, which will achieve Ealing's internal criteria for sensitive rooms.  The details should also include the provision of alternative means of ventilation in accordance with Authority's criteria.  The works should be completed before occupation and permanently retained thereafter.  REASON:  To protect occupiers of the dwellinhouse  from railway  noise in accordance with policies 7.15 of the London Plan 2011 and policies 4.1, 5.5 and  4.11 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004),  Supplementary Planning Guidance SPG 10: 'Noise and Vibration' and policy 1.1 (j) of the Ealing's Development (Core) Strategy 2026. | Notwithstanding the provisions of Classes A, B, C, D E and F of Part 1 of Schedule 2 to the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 1995 (or any subsequent order revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modifications),  no enlargement, improvement or other alteration to the dwellinghouses hereby approved shall be carried out without the prior permission of the Local Planning Authority, obtained through the submission of a planning application. REASON:	To prevent the overdevelopment of the site to safeguard the living conditions of adjoining properties and visual appearance of the buildings and the area as a whole,  in accordance with policies 3.5, 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan 2011 and policies 4.1 and 5.5 of the adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), policies 1.1 (g) (h), 1.2 (f), 3.1(b) and 3.8 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies LV 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Draft Development Management Development Plan Document (2013). | No part of the roof of the dwellinghouse hereby approved shall be used as or altered to form a balcony, roof garden, roof terrace or similar amenity area.  REASON: In the interests of the living conditions of occupiers of nearby properties in accordance with policies 4.1 and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and policies 1.1(g), 3.1 (b) and 3.8 of the Adopted Development (or Core) Strategy and policies 7.4 and 7.6 of The London Plan 'Spatial Development Strategy for Greater London' (July 2011).
